ambition.question: Did you let your desire for power and dominance influence how you treat others, particularly in situations where you have authority or influence?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: to prideful self - exaltation over humble service
ambition.question: Did you let your desire for power influence your decisions, leading to prideful self-exaltation over humble service to others?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

oppression.question: Did I mistreat, harass, or discriminate against others through my actions?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

extracted_data_phrases: by exercising power or authority over them in unjust or cruel ways
oppression.question: Did I ever intentionally or unintentionally mistreat others by exercising power or authority over them in unjust or cruel ways?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

autonomy.question: Did you take for granted your accomplishments and success, forgetting to acknowledge God's providence in guiding them?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted my personal accomplishments, forgetting to acknowledge God's providence in guiding me towards success?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

envy.question: Have I felt envious thoughts about others' successes, and secretly wished they would experience setbacks in their endeavors?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and use inappropriate language in interactions with others, thereby disrespecting their dignity?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control when speaking to others in public settings?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what is reasonable
perhaps by consuming excessive amounts of food or drinks during meals or social gatherings
gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what is reasonable, perhaps by consuming excessive amounts of food or drinks during meals or social gatherings?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, possibly leading to excessive food waste?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what is reasonable
gluttony.question: Did I excessively indulge in eating or drinking beyond what is reasonable, thereby neglecting my body's need for moderation?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: over my family 's needs and responsibilities
prodigality.question: Have I excessively prioritized non-essential financial pursuits over my family's needs and responsibilities, thereby recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to me?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: over my financial responsibilities or family needs
prodigality.question: Have I excessively prioritized leisure activities, such as hobbies or entertainment, over my financial responsibilities or family needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: to spending money on leisure activities over my family 's financial needs
on leisure activities over my family 's financial needs
prodigality.question: Have I given precedence to spending money on leisure activities over my family's financial needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

at social gatherings or online communities where I 've connected with friends

gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I shared others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true, for my own pleasure?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: on a Sunday , when it otherwise could be avoided
impiety.question: Did I engage in work on a Sunday, when it otherwise could be avoided?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).
